gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.labels
Class Interval

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.labels.Interval

public final class Interval
extends Object

An interval defines a continuous, closed segment of integers. The segment is defined by the index (lower integer) and the post (higher integer), and contains all integers between index and post, including index and post themselves.

An interval is empty if 

index > post
, and contains no integer.

Intervals are immutable.

Methods of this class do not allow null arguments.

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com

Constructor Detail

Interval

public Interval(int index,
                int post)
Creates an interval with the given index and post integers.

Parameters:
index - the index (the lowest integer of the created interval)
post - the post (the highest integer of the created interval)
Method Detail

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Returns the index, i.e. the lowest integer of this interval.

getPost

public int getPost()
Returns the post, i.e. the highest integer of this interval.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns whether this interval is empty (or if 
getPost() < getIndex()
). An empty interval contains and overlaps with nothing.

intersection

public Interval intersection(Interval other)
Returns the intersection of this interval with another, or the greatest shared interval of the two. The intersection of a non-empty interval with an empty is the empty interval.

See Also:
isEmpty()

union

public Interval union(Interval other)
Returns the union of this interval with another, or the smallest interval that contains both. The union of a non-empty interval with an empty is the non-empty interval.

See Also:
isEmpty()

contains

public boolean contains(int point)
Returns whether a given integer is contained in this interval, i.e. whether 
index <= point && point <= post
holds.

contains

public boolean contains(Interval other)
Returns whether a this interval contains entirely another interval. If the specified interval is empty, 
false
is returned; an empty interval is assumed to not be contained anywhere.

overlapsWith

public boolean overlapsWith(Interval other)
Returns whether the intersection of this and another interval is non-empty.

canBeMergedWith

public boolean canBeMergedWith(Interval other)
Returns whether this interval is overlapping or immediately neighboring with the given one, so both can be safely replaced by their union. For example, [1, 5] and [6, 10] can be merged (to their union, [1, 10]), as can [1, 5] and [4, 10] too, while [1, 5] and [7, 10] cannot; their union would also contain 6 which was included in neither interval.

length

public int length()
Returns the number of points contained in this interval.

withIndex

public Interval withIndex(int index)
Creates a new interval with the specified index, and the same post number as this interval.

withPost

public Interval withPost(int post)
Creates a new interval with the specified post, and the same index number as this interval.

empty

public static Interval empty()
Returns an empty interval.
